newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Progressive's Q3 sales fall 2.1 pct.
newsitem.headline: Progressive's Q3 sales fall 2.1 pct.

text.p: Progressive Enterprises Ltd said on Tuesday group sales for the 13 weeks to April 27 were worth NZ$523.2 million, down 2.1 percent on the third quarter of 1996.
Year-to-date sales of NZ$1.59 billion were 1.9 percent below the prior year.

On a comparable basis -- removing the impact of store and restaurant openings and closures -- group sales fell by 0.1 percent for the quarter and 0.8 percent for the year-to-date. All divisions were performing in line with expectations.
Foodtown continued to trade above prior levels, while Countdown traded marginally below that of the previous year.
3 Guys stores traded significantly below that of the prior year on a comparable store basis.
The board had approved recommendations on future branding, format and network issues which will see the rationalisation over several years of the company's supermarkets into two distinct groups.
The first would be a chain of regional superstores branded as Countdown and secondly a chain of neighbourhood conventional supermarkets trading as Foodtown.
